title: remotes have annex-ignore set with python api, but work in cli
body:
There is a dataset that I have created in GIN: https://gin.g-node.org/SakshamSharda/ophys_testing1
Followd with the usual commands:

1. Create a local repo with the required data (binary and text files)

Ran commands:
```shell
datalad create -c text2git -f .
datalad save -m "messg"
git gc --prune=now
datalad siblings add -d . --name gin --url https://gin.g-node.org/SakshamSharda/ophys_testing1.git
datalad push --to gin
```
 3. All uploaded and looks good on the repo on GIN.
4. For round trip, I clone that using datalad clone https://gin.g-node.org/SakshamSharda/ophys_testing1.git
5. All symlinks downloaded, good. Then datalad get "add of symlink" . Got the actual dataset, good.

**PROBLEM:**

If i do the same procedure using the python api using dataset = 
```
datalad.api.install('https://gin.g-node.org/SakshamSharda/ophys_testing1.git') 
dataset.get(dataset_path)
```
 i get an error like:
```
[ERROR] not available; (Note that these git remotes have annex-ignore set: origin) [get(~\ophys_testing1\segmentation_datasets\extract\2014_04_01_p203_m19_check01_extractAnalysis.mat)] 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "~\venv\lib\site-packages\wrapt\wrappers.py", line 605, in __call__
    return self._self_wrapper(self.__wrapped__, self._self_instance,
  File "~\venv\lib\site-packages\datalad\distribution\dataset.py", line 503, in apply_func
    return f(**kwargs)
  File "~\venv\lib\site-packages\wrapt\wrappers.py", line 566, in __call__
    return self._self_wrapper(self.__wrapped__, self._self_instance,
  File "~\venv\lib\site-packages\datalad\interface\utils.py", line 495, in eval_func
    return return_func(generator_func)(*args, **kwargs)
  File "~\venv\lib\site-packages\wrapt\wrappers.py", line 566, in __call__
    return self._self_wrapper(self.__wrapped__, self._self_instance,
  File "~\venv\lib\site-packages\datalad\interface\utils.py", line 483, in return_func
    results = list(results)
  File "C:\Users\Saksham\Documents\NWB\roiextractors\venv\lib\site-packages\datalad\interface\utils.py", line 468, in generator_func
    raise IncompleteResultsError(
datalad.support.exceptions.IncompleteResultsError: Command did not complete successfully. 1 failed:
[{'action': 'get',
  'annexkey': 'MD5E-s1183261--22827ea35bda2a7d678e5f86e875fc5b.mat',
  'message': 'not available; (Note that these git remotes have annex-ignore '
             'set: origin)',
  'path': '~\\ophys_testing1\\segmentation_datasets\\extract\\2014_04_01_p203_m19_check01_extractAnalysis.mat',
  'refds': '~\\ophys_testing1',
  'status': 'error',
  'type': 'file'}]
```
**datalad version: 0.13.7**
